mdRecord.dcterms:title: Horse teeth clacker P600062
mdRecord.dcterms:description: We assess age by examining the lower incisor teeth, as they are easily accessible when the mouth is opened. In this model, notice the presence of adult incisor teeth with a central groove on the surface that labial surface. The chewing occlusal surface is not oval and presence of the cups (black areas located at the side of the tooth close to the tongue (lingual). The cups are clearly seen on the corner and intermediate incisors and almost disappeared from the central incisors which is a feature of 6 years old horse. Notice also the clear dental star (brown line) close to the labial side in the central and intermediate incisors. Please compare this model with the foal's decideous "milky" teeth clacker P600088.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Horses--Aging
Horses--Age determination
